channel.title: Tskins and Vskins
channel.description:
So as I understand tskins is sorta like bone structure of the model and Vskins is how much those bones are affected by the animation right? I'm trying to understand what these values are and how they can be utilized to make new stuff. Any input is welcome thanks.
This is what got me thinking about this and the way I view this now.
https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/wiki/3D-animations-and-skinning

item.title: Tskins and Vskins
item.dc:creator: @hadlich4 hadlich4
item.description:
@hadlich4 wrote:

sini:

They are groupings of triangles and vertices used in order to do different transformations to the model using an animation sequence which is a list of various transformations like rotations or updating the alpha level of certain triangles. Bones are vskins, skins I guess are just tskin. The naming is pretty shitty in that regard I prefer just triangle and vertex groupings.

So with all that said how do you utilize this as in how do you know what mats to put using metaseq and the color palette and what to set the 2 weights as when making new models besides the normal walking character with two arms and two legs

Read full topic

They are groupings of triangles and vertices used in order to do different transformations to the model using an animation sequence which is a list of various transformations like rotations or updating the alpha level of certain triangles. Bones are vskins, skins I guess are just tskin. The naming is pretty shitty in that regard I prefer just triangle and vertex groupings.
